net.viktorc.pspp.core

Class PSPPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.viktorc.pspp.core.PSPPool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class PSPPool
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    A class for maintaining a pool of identical pre-started processes.
    Author:
    A6714

    • Constructor Detail

      • PSPPool

        public PSPPool(java.lang.String[] processCommands,
               ProcessListener listener,
               int minPoolSize,
               int maxPoolSize,
               int queueSize,
               long keepAliveTime)
        throws java.io.IOException,
               java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs a pool of identical processes. The initial size of the pool is the minimum pool size. The size of the pool is dynamically adjusted based on the number of requests and running processes.
        Parameters:
        processCommands - The commands to start the process that will be pooled.
        listener - A #ProcessListener instance that is added to each process in the pool. It should be stateless as the same instance is used for all processes.
        minPoolSize - The minimum size of the process pool.
        maxPoolSize - The maximum size of the process pool.
        queueSize - The number of tasks the queue can accommodate. If it is 0 or less, the queue will not be limited.
        keepAliveTime - The number of milliseconds after which idle processes are cancelled. If it is 0 or less, the life-cycle of the processes will not be limited.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the process cannot be started.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If minPoolSize is less than 1 or maxPoolSize is less than minPoolSize.

      • PSPPool

               int minPoolSize,
               int maxPoolSize,
               int queueSize)
        throws java.io.IOException,

    • Method Detail

      • setLogging

        public void setLogging(boolean on)
        Sets whether the pool should log to the console.
        Parameters:
        on - Whether the pool should log to the console.

      • executeCommand

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<?> executeCommand(java.lang.String command,
                                                     CommandListener commandListener,
                                                     boolean cancelProcessAfterwards)
        Executes the command on any of the available processes in the pool. It blocks until the command could successfully be submitted for execution.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to send to the process' standard in.
        commandListener - The #CommandListener instance that possibly processes the outputs of the process and determines when the process has finished processing the sent command.
        cancelProcessAfterwards - Whether the process that executed the command should be cancelled after the execution of the command.
        Returns:
        A Future instance for the submitted command.

           throws java.lang.Exception
